version_description:
- You can now set a habit for once a week!
- Fixed an issue with the custom counter not properly displaying the last update date
- Fixed an issue where editing a journal entry date would not automatically update the journal table
- Various stability improvements, visual fixes and some (embarrassing) typo corrections

Multiple Daily Check-ins and new frequency options
By popular request, it is now possible to check-in multiple times during the day. We’ve also added more frequency options and new ways to track your progress.

Multiple reminders
Setup multiple reminders for each habit or activity.

Enhancements
- It is now possible to delete custom covers in ‘My Covers’
- The habit cover now displays your taget frequency and an indicator of your progress
- It is now possible view your progress from the habits overview screen
- It is now possible to create a habit with a start date older than 90 days
- Added the option to turn off the sound effects
- Added measuring units in the workouts chart.

Bugfixes
- Tapping on an notification does not open the corresponding habit
- The positioning of newly added items in the Milestones card
- 3D Touch icon shortcut could in some cases bypass the lock screen
- Fixed issues with certain asian language types
- Setting up an activity to a frequency of once per week could set it as twice per week instead.
- The badge counter could be truncated in certain cases
- Fixed various typos
- Fixed issue with the presentation of Imperial measurement units of weight

== Features ==

- Today now has a Notification Center widget. Get a clear view of your habits and check-in on opening the app!
Tap on the circular progress bar to check-in on a habit, tap on the habit name to open the habit directly in Today.
- For iOS 10 users, reminder notifications have just become richer! Notifications now present details about your habit, current progress and of course the option to check-in or jump to your habit.
- Habits can now be marked as "private", hiding their details in the Notification Center Widget to protect them from prying eyes.
- New Apple Health cards: Mindful Minutes, Wheelchair pushes, Wheelchair distance, Swimming Strokes and Swimming Distance can now be added to any habit.

== Fixes ==

- Body fat percentage chart has been fixed to properly display the percentage values
- Corrections in the Chinese translation (thanks to all of you who pointed out the mistakes)
- Fixed an issue that would make the habit progress screen to chop content in certain devices
- Visual fixes and improvements
- Disabling iCloud or Dropbox backup now gives you the option to keep or discard your data (keep was the default until now)

As always your feedback is valuable, so please feel free to contact us for any remark or suggestion. Also, if you enjoy the app, a review on the App Store is more than welcome :)
Fixed a bug that would crash the app when a backup target was enabled (sincere apologies for that)

- Fixed an issue that could cause problems in backup and restore
- Fixed a problem with "What's new" option crashing the app
- Corrected and improved mindful minutes card and goal setting intervals for Workouts
- A number of smaller fixes and stability improvements

- Fixed an issue with certain Health charts acting strangely on some occasions
- Fixed an issue with the notification centre widget not updating correctly when start day for week is changed

Today now has an Apple Watch app! Use Today  on your Apple Watch to swiftly view your habits for the day, check on their status and perform or cancel check-ins. The Watch face complication shows how many of the due habits have been completed for the current day.

- Fixed a couple of bugs that could crash the app when adding a new habit or renaming a custom counter card
- Improvements in the Apple Watch complication
Ironed out some issues with the Apple Watch

- We are introducing a new card from our friends at Welzen for tracking your meditations!
- Apple Watch bug fixes and stability improvements

- Adaptations for iOS 11 and WatchOS4
- Apple Watch bug fixes and stability improvements
- A fix that could cause the app to malfunction during restore when specific cards were used

Actions with callback URLs

- This version introduces action URLs based on the “x-url-callback” specification that open up a world of possibilities. Action URLs are unique URLs generated inside Today that can be called by other apps to perform a specific action like check-in on a habit, jump to a specific habit, open up your habits overview, retrieve information about a particular habit and many more. All action URLs can be used only if you give permission to the external app. If you have enabled a passcode, Touch-ID or Face-ID lock the action will run only when you unlock Today. To find out more about Action URLs in Today go to Settings and tap on the “Action URLs” section.

Fixes

- Fixed an issue with the circular progress bar on the Apple Watch
- Fixed the way automatic backups are handled after creating a new habit
- Various visual fixes in the badges and streak calendar card

- Fixed an issue with Face ID or Touch ID crashing the app
- The start date for a new habit can now be set up to 3 years in the past
- Various stability fixes and improvements
- Fixed an issue with the milestones widget not behaving properly

Data & Privacy
Your privacy has always been a top-priority for Today.
We've added a new dialog in Today that helps you understand how your data is handled inside the app and let you know about your options.

Manage data options
We've added a new section in Today's settings that helps you export and delete your data.

New cards:
How stressed have you been lately? All little bit of stress is healthy but feeling stressed over a long period of time can cause serious problems for your emotional and physical health. With the release of Today v.1.9, we're introducing the ""Stress levels"" card, a unique new way to help you answer that question.

Powered, by Limbic's innovative algorithm, the Stress levels card uses artificial intelligence to process data from specific Apple Health categories, gathered by your Apple Watch to estimate your stress levels on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. The Stress Levels card will try to estimate your Stress Levels during the day and update your Stress Level score so that you can easily compare your stress levels through time.

New Features:
Today is now available in 5 new languages: Korean, Italian, Russian, Turkish and Portuguese!

Fixes
This release brings a few changes to the way your notifications are scheduled to ensure they are always delivered on time.

Fixes
This release brings a few changes to the way your notifications are scheduled to ensure they are always delivered on time.

Multiple weekly and monthly habits
We’ve completely reworked the way Today handles monthly, and weekly habits. Until now, the progress of weekly and monthly habits was based on daily check-ins which is not the ideal way to track your progress for these kinds of habits. Starting from this version of Today, all your progress for weekly and monthly habits is based on weeks and months respectively so that you can finally track these habits properly. As an added bonus, this change made it possible to increase the number of check-ins per week or month!

Skipping
You now have the option to skip a day, week or month. "Skipping" is great when you can’t do a check-in for an on-going habit due to special circumstances (e.g. You are on vacation, you got sick for a few days, it’s a special day for you etc.) When you skip a day, week or month your streak won’t break and you can always undo a "skip", if you change your mind.

Redesigned streak calendar
We have redesigned the way the Streak calendar looks in order to make it easier to track your progress visually. We’ve added a new way of representing streaks as well as helpful indicators that show which days are skipped and which days contain check-ins.

Fixes:
- Fixed a bug that would corrupt the habit frequency of existing or newly setup habits. If you experience that issue, please edit each one of your habits to select the desired frequency, after installing the update.
- Several stability fixes on the Apple Watch and iPhone

New Features!

Easier check-ins

Check-ins are finally as simple as one tap. Each tap on a date on the Streak calendar, will increase the check-ins for that day by one so no more dialogs to open and close! If you want to remove a check-in, long-press on the date to bring up a new control that provides a fast and easy way to add, remove check-ins or the option to skip.

Better representation of days with check-ins

When you perform a check-in, Today will mark that day on the streak calendar with a light green background. This will replace the green dot that appears under the date which was harder to notice visually. We are keeping the green dot under the date only when a day is part of a streak so that you can see which days contain check-ins and which don’t.

Fixes

- Fixed an issue that would cause crashes and instability when the user selected no weekdays as a target goal.
- Fixed an issue that produces an inaccurate calculation of streaks
- Several stability fixes on the Apple Watch and iPhone
